techmeme.title: A California man pleads guilty to illegally accessing Disney's Slack channels and stealing 1.1TB of data in 2024; he later posed as hacktivist group "NullBulge" (Lawrence Abrams/BleepingComputer)
Sources: Beijing's decision to exempt eight types of US-made chips from tariffs came after auto industry lobbying, exposing China's dependence on US auto chips (Wall Street Journal)
Memo: the US DOD seeks to secure right-to-repair provisions in Army contracts to access tools, software, and technical data without IP constraints (Reuters)
Apple updates its App Store Guidelines to comply with a US judge's April 30 injunction, including allowing app developers to link to external payments in the US (Chance Miller/9to5Mac)
Temu appears to have removed all products in the US version of its online store that ship directly from China to US consumers, confusing suppliers and customers (Zeyi Yang/Wired)
